channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Elon Musk Calls Peter Navarro a ‘Moron’ in Escalating Tariff Fight
item.description: The feud between two of President Trump’s top advisers is playing out as the administration’s new tariffs have caused huge losses across global financ...

item.title: Trump to Sign Order Aimed at Reviving a Struggling Coal Industry
item.description: The moves include loosening environmental rules, but it is unclear how much they can help reverse the sharp decline in coal power over the last two de...

item.title: Researchers uncover a link to autism—and it isn’t vaccines
item.description: The large meta-analysis is the latest to show a connection between autism and diabetes.

item.title: Trump’s Tariffs Are Already Reducing Car Imports and Idling Factories
item.description: A few carmakers have closed factories, laid off workers or shifted production in response to the auto tariffs that took effect last week.

item.title: Angry tourists are ditching vacations in the U.S. over Trump’s ‘bullying’: ‘The U.S. is not perceived as a welcoming destination’
item.description: The U.S. tourism industry expected 2025 to be another good year, but international arrivals are plummeting.

item.title: Republican officials are questioning Trump’s tariff regime behind the scenes, says Sen. Rand Paul. ‘They whisper in my ear: Free trade is good’
item.description: GOP donors and think tanks are starting to publicly denounce President Donald Trump’s policies, which led to a historic stock market rout.

item.title: TodayTix CEO took over at 31. He tells aspirational Gen Zers to ditch the ‘fake it till you make it’ act if they actually want to be successful
item.description: While Amazon’s Andy Jassy aligns with Gen Z's “delulu” mindset, TodayTix’s CEO says faking it early in his career burned him out—and backfired.

item.title: Man Pleads Guilty to Trying to Assassinate Justice Kavanaugh
item.description: Nicholas J. Roske, 29, of California, faces a maximum sentence of life in prison. He was arrested near the justice’s home in 2022, with a pistol, a kn...

item.title: How a Diversity Champion Became an Anti-D.E.I. Warrior
item.description: Not long before he became Virginia’s governor, Glenn Youngkin helped lead, and spoke approvingly of, efforts to improve racial and gender diversity at...

item.title: Inside Blockworks’ plans to build the Bloomberg of crypto by packaging data and media
item.description: The landscape in crypto media has shifted rapidly, and Blockworks co-founder Jason Yanowitz sees a big opportunity.

item.title: Europe Prepares to Counter Trump’s Tariff Moves. Will Retaliation Work?
item.description: Europe wants to negotiate, but it is also trying to project strength. As Trump warns nations against retaliation, that strategy could be perilous.

item.title: Dominican Republic Nightclub Roof Collapse: At Least 15 Killed
item.description: Heavy machinery and drones were part of a large search and rescue operation at the Jet Set nightclub in Santo Domingo, the capital.

item.title: Israel’s Supreme Court Pauses Netanyahu’s Attempt to Fire Spy Chief
item.description: The hearing opened with unruly scenes as hecklers forced the justices to halt the proceedings and then to resume them without a public audience. The g...

item.title: Some Israelis Favor Attacking Iran, Expressing Skepticism About Talks
item.description: Many Israelis were surprised when President Trump announced that the United States would engage in “direct” negotiations with Tehran in an effort to r...
